+1hour added to harvest

Hi Britt, 

Confirming the requested changes have been completed in 1 hour of support time. 
You can see them via the links below: 

https://investmenttrends.com/in-the-news
1. Limit view to 10 entries to be shown
2. Add pagination - Unable to complete
3. Introduce "published date" to the custom post https://investmenttrends.com/wp-admin/edit.php?post_type=in-the-news
4. Apply chronological sort to "in the news" post > oldest to newest based on publish date.

https://investmenttrends.com/industry-research/key-industry-reports/
1. add button that can be linked to the clients page of choice (screenshot)

Please note, point 2 for in the news was unable to be completed as the sort function overrides the pagination function. E.g. with sort function applied, there is no way to correctly display page count as the quantity of results changes. From our research, there isn't a existing tool we can use to overcome this. We would have to dedicate some time to this and see if we can code the function for you.

action.text: Chris Paradowski assigned to Chris Paradowski

full_threads.body:
Hi Britt, 

Yes, we can do that. To make this easier to track I have started a new thread (which allocates a new support ticket) and consolidated your requests into one list. Can you please check the list to ensure we have listed everything you need? Once confirmed, I'll get the team started. 

https://investmenttrends.com/in-the-news
1. Limit view to 10 entries to be shown
2. Add pagination
3. Introduce "published date" to the custom post https://investmenttrends.com/wp-admin/edit.php?post_type=in-the-news
4. Apply chronological sort to "in the news" post > oldest to newest based on publish date.

For https://investmenttrends.com/industry-research/key-industry-reports/ updates, are you able to provide a layout for the destination page?
